title: Living Root Bridge
desc: A remarkable natural marvel, these bridges are grown and woven from the roots of the Indian rubber tree by the local Khasi people. The Double Decker Living Root Bridge is a must-see for its incredible engineering and beauty.

reviews.reviewText: An unforgettable trek and a truly amazing sight. The bridge is a testament to nature's power and human ingenuity.

title: Nohkalikai Falls
desc: India's tallest plunge waterfall, cascading from a height of 1,115 feet into a mesmerizing turquoise pool. The surrounding landscape is lush and green, offering a breathtaking view.

reviews.reviewText: The view is absolutely stunning! The sound of the falling water is therapeutic.

title: Dawki & Umngot River
desc: Experience a surreal boat ride on the Umngot River, known for its crystal-clear water where you can see the riverbed clearly. It is also an important international trading hub between India and Bangladesh.

reviews.reviewText: The water is so clear it's unbelievable! A very peaceful and beautiful experience.

title: Mawlynnong Village
desc: Often called 'God's Own Garden', this village is renowned for its cleanliness and is a model for eco-tourism. Explore the village on foot and enjoy the peaceful and pristine environment.

reviews.reviewText: Incredibly clean and well-maintained. A beautiful example of sustainable living.

title: Krang Suri Falls
desc: A breathtaking waterfall with stunning turquoise-blue water, located in the Jaintia Hills. The short trek to the falls is an experience in itself, surrounded by lush greenery.

reviews.reviewText: The colors of the water are unbelievable. A perfect spot for photography and swimming.

title: Laitlum Canyons
desc: Laitlum, meaning 'end of hills', offers a panoramic view of the spectacular canyons and verdant valleys of Meghalaya. It's a popular trekking destination and a spot for breathtaking views.

reviews.reviewText: The view from the top is absolutely worth the effort. Feels like you're on top of the world.

title: Mawsmai Cave
desc: Explore this magnificent limestone cave system, one of the most accessible caves in the region. It's well-lit and offers a glimpse into the beautiful and intricate world of stalactites and stalagmites.

reviews.reviewText: A thrilling and fun experience. The rock formations are amazing and the cool air inside is very refreshing.
